name: cultish
content:
Add to word list

intended to be very popular with a particular small group of people: cultish following Outside Morocco, the music has a cultish following, but here it's huge. Michael is charming and open, and there is nothing remotely cultish about him.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is a writer of cultish comedies aimed at young adults.Theatre in the city ranges from big companies that put on popular productions to fringe companies producing work for small, cultish audiences.It was first published only 13 years ago, but it seems like a lifetime has passed since he wrote his cultish debut.
